definition: to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
to collapse/to break or wear down/to defeat

sentences.english: All opponents were crushed or overawed.
sentences.chinese: 所有敵人都被壓垮或懾服。

sentences.english: The old bridge threatened to colla e beneath the weight of our truck.
sentences.chinese: 這座老舊的橋樑恐怕快被我們卡車的重量給壓垮了。

sentences.english: The heavy burden has brayed him.
sentences.chinese: 沉重的擔子把他壓垮了。

sentences.english: Japan is being overwhelmed by international forces.
sentences.chinese: 日本正在被來自國際的各方力量壓垮。

sentences.english: A masonry chimney that could crumble and fall through an unsupported roof.
sentences.chinese: 石制煙囪壓垮無支撐的房頂並崩塌。

sentences.english: It is possible for a server to simply be overwhelmed with requests.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅是請求就壓垮了服務器，這種情況是可能的。

sentences.english: Finally, at the age of 42, this secret authorship began to wear me down.
sentences.chinese: 最後，在我42歲那年，這些作品終於將我壓垮了。

sentences.english: Anything less, and we will be overwhelmed when everything we have been afraid of comes pouring out.
sentences.chinese: 當我們害怕的所有一切迸發出來時，我們就會被壓垮。

sentences.english: A  masonry chimney that could crumble and fall through an unsupported roof.
sentences.chinese: 石制煙囪可能壓垮無支撐的房頂並崩塌。

sentences.english: Otherwise, all of that toil will eventually become overwhelming.
sentences.chinese: 否則，所有的辛苦最後會壓垮你。

sentences.english: She is weighed down with many troubles.
sentences.chinese: 她被衆多的困難壓垮了。

sentences.english: I feel overwhelmed by the daily work.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我被每天的工作壓垮了。

sentences.english: In some ways New York overwhelms him.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上紐約把他給壓垮了。
